thread.title: Cricket: Pakistan spearhead Yasir sidelined by hip injury - reports

title: Cricket: Pakistan spearhead Yasir sidelined by hip injury - reports
text:
April 10, 2018 / 5:08 AM / Updated 8 hours ago Cricket: Pakistan spearhead Yasir sidelined by hip injury - reports Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
(Reuters) - Pakistan will be without slow-bowling spearhead Yasir Shah for their upcoming tour of the British Isles after the leg-spinner sustained a hip injury which is expected to sideline him for roughly 10 weeks. 
The 31-year-old represented Lahore Qalandars in the recent Pakistan Super League but complained of pain in his hip bone, an injury which warrants four weeks of rest then six weeks of active rehabilitation, according to local media reports. 
In the absence of Yasir, who has amassed 165 wickets in just 28 tests, Pakistan selectors are expected to turn to fellow leg-spinner Shadab Khan and left-arm spinner Kashif Bhatti for the tour. 
Ireland will play their inaugural test against Pakistan from May 11-15 before the South Asian team play two tests against England at Lord’s (May 24-28) and Headingley (June 1-5). 
Pakistan will also play two Twenty20 Internationals against Scotland on June 12 and 13, both at Edinburgh’s Grange Cricket Club Ground. Reporting by Amlan Chakraborty in New Delhi; Editing by John O'Brien
